opportunities.name: Alzheimer's Association Oklahoma Chapter
opportunities.description: To eliminate Alzheimer's disease through the advancement of research; to provide and enhance care and support for all affected; and to reduce the risk of dementia through the promotion of brain health.

opportunities.name: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Oklahoma
opportunities.description: We are looking for volunteers to be paired with local youth who need encouragement. Mentors do activities with their Little Brother or Little sister for a couple hours a couple times a month.

opportunities.name: Bike Club
opportunities.description: Building confident cyclists and great Tulsans through community engagement

opportunities.name: Camp Fire Green Country
opportunities.description: Camp Fire provides the opportunity for children to find their spark, lift their voice, and discover who they are.

opportunities.name: CAP Tulsa
opportunities.description: CAP Tulsa believes every child and every family deserves the same opportunity for success.

opportunities.name: Centenarians of Oklahoma
opportunities.description: Centenarians of Oklahoma is a rapidly growing, nonprofit organization whose sole purpose is to honor citizens of Oklahoma who are 100 years of age or older.

opportunities.name: Challenger 7 Park Community Garden & Food Forest
opportunities.description: The garden and food forest is helping to build a more resilient community by bringing healthier food choices and serving as a learning space for nutritional education and sustainability to a food desert in the Red Fork area of Tulsa.

opportunities.name: Child Abuse Network
opportunities.description: To provide collaborative intervention services to child abuse victims, so that they are encouraged to embrace a future driven by hope.

opportunities.name: Citizens Climate Lobby Tulsa Chapter
opportunities.description:
Citizens
Climate Lobby is a non-profit, non-partisan, grassroots advocacy organization focused on national policies to address climate change.

opportunities.name: City of Tulsa Animal Welfare
opportunities.description: City of Tulsa Animal Welfare is dedicated to providing temporary shelter, compassionate care and humane disposition of lost and unwanted animals; investigating and preventing animal cruelty, neglect and inhumane treatment; enforcing animal ordinances and laws; assuring public health and safety; and promoting responsible pet ownership.

opportunities.name: Clarehouse
opportunities.description: Clarehouse is a loving home for terminally ill people, providing living space, practical care and access to hospice services - devoted to the care of dying people and to the support of their loved ones.

opportunities.name: Collegiate Hall
opportunities.description: Collegiate Hall gives parents in our city another choice – a truly college-preparatory option. Collegiate Hall delivers a school that focuses on providing rigorous academics, an achievement-oriented school culture, and a commitment to working with parents to ensure every child’s success.

opportunities.name: Communities in School of Mid-America
opportunities.description: CIS of Mid-America uses an evidence-based model, implemented by school-based Site Coordinators, to bring community resources into schools, removing barriers to learning, and keeping kids in schools and on the path to graduation. We leverage relationships, local resources, and evidence to drive results.

opportunities.name: Community Food Bank of Eastern Oklahoma
opportunities.description: The mission of the Community Food Bank of Eastern Oklahoma is to feed the hungry of eastern Oklahoma through a network of Partner Programs and to engage our communities in ending hunger. Our vision is food security, with dignity, for all eastern Oklahomans.

opportunities.name: Domestic Violence Intervention Services, INC.
opportunities.description: The DVIS mission is to rebuild lives affected by domestic violence and sexual assault through advocacy, shelter, counseling, and education.

opportunities.name: Emergency Infant Services
opportunities.description: Emergency Infant Services (EIS) provides basic needs help for children five and under.

opportunities.name: Fab Lab Tulsa
opportunities.description: Fab Lab Tulsa delivers education, community and business programming that teaches innovation, design-thinking, problem-solving and change-making. In addition, the lab provides open community access to advanced manufacturing and digital fabrication tools, equipment, technology and resources.

opportunities.name: Gathering Place
opportunities.description: Imagine a park that offers amazing attractions and world-class programming for all ages with no entry fee.

opportunities.name: Global Gardens
opportunities.description: The mission of Global Gardens is to empower students in low-income communities to become agents of change through hands-on science and peace education.

opportunities.name: Hospitality House of Tulsa
opportunities.description: We offer a home away from home for families caring for loved ones in medical crisis.

opportunities.name: Housing Authority of the City of Tulsa
opportunities.description: Public Housing Agency that enhances the quality of life in Tulsa through the efforts of a professional, caring, and responsive staff and Board.

opportunities.name: INCOG Area Agency on Aging
opportunities.description: The mission of INCOG Area Agency on Aging is to improve the quality of life by promoting independence, dignity, and health for senior citizens in Creek, Osage and Tulsa counties through advocacy, education and support of community-based services.

opportunities.name: John 3:16 Mission
opportunities.description: In the Name and through the Loving Grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, John 3:16 Mission reclaims lives and restores hope to the homeless and at-risk men, women, and children as it ministers to their physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual needs.

opportunities.name: Lisa Bain Ministries
opportunities.description: Delivering hope and support to those who are facing illness, a special need, or a crisis situation.

opportunities.name: Junior Achievement of Oklahoma
opportunities.description: To inspire and prepare young people to succeed in a global economy.

opportunities.name: JUVENGAF INC
opportunities.description: JUVENGAF, a community outreach program.

opportunities.name: Life Senior Services
opportunities.description: LIFE Senior Services specializes in home and community-based services that promote healthy aging and aging-in-place for seniors, as well as services and support for family caregivers who play a critical role in helping their loved ones continue living at home.

opportunities.name: Lindsey House
opportunities.description: Lindsey House provides long-term shelter and supportive services to women caring for children. Our mission is to support these families as they transition from homelessness, learn important life skills, and regain the confidence to become self-sufficient.
opportunities.work_type: Homeless Support, Family Support, Life Skills

opportunities.name: Make-A-Wish Oklahoma
opportunities.description: Every 34 minutes Make-A-Wish® grants the wish of a child diagnosed with a life-threatening medical condition in the United States and its territories. We believe that a wish experience can be a game-changer.

opportunities.name: Meals on Wheels of Metro Tulsa
opportunities.description: Our mission is to provide nutritious meals, safety checks, and friendly, caring contact to elderly and disabled home bound individuals in Tulsa and surrounding areas.

opportunities.name: MODUS
opportunities.description: Modus is a non-profit that removes barriers through innovative transportation solutions, education, and advocacy.

opportunities.name: Mosaic
opportunities.description: Mosaic will educate, lead and influence businesses on creating diverse and inclusive workforce cultures to enhance their competitive advantage.

opportunities.name: Muslims4Mercy
opportunities.description: Muslims4Mercy is a humanitarian organization that services the Tulsa community.

opportunities.name: New Hope Oklahoma
opportunities.description: New Hope began in 1992 as a volunteer run summer camp for children whose parents were incarcerated.

opportunities.name: Oklahoma Aquarium
opportunities.description: To educate and inspire conservation of our aquatic world through interactive discovery.

opportunities.name: Oklahoma Center for Community and Justice
opportunities.description: The Oklahoma Center for Community and Justice (OCCJ) is a human relations organization solely dedicated to achieving respect and understanding for all people through education, advocacy and dialogue.

opportunities.name: Parkinson Foundation of Oklahoma
opportunities.description: The Parkinson Foundation of Oklahoma is the largest and most active non-profit organization in the state dedicated to supporting Parkinson's families.

opportunities.name: Pathways Adult Learning Center
opportunities.description: This mission of Pathways is to provide a unique Christian program dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for adults with intellectual disabilities.

opportunities.name: Philbrook Museum of Art
opportunities.description: Philbrook strives to be an essential and exceptional participant in the cultural, educational, and economic life of a growing and diverse community , and remains dedicated to inspiring the broadest possible public engagement, access, and service.

opportunities.name: Porta Caeli House
opportunities.description: The mission of Porta Caeli House is to extend Christ’s love to those in need through compassionate end-of-life care, when dying at home is not an option.

opportunities.name: #Racismstinks
opportunities.description: #racismstinks seeks to cultivate a diverse coalition of people unified in the task of healing racial divisions in our community through education, public speaking, and community activities. It takes us all.

opportunities.name: YMCA of Greater Tulsa
opportunities.description: Our volunteer program is the cornerstone of the YMCA movement.

opportunities.name: Reading Partners
opportunities.description: Our mission is to help children become lifelong readers by empowering communities to provide individualized instruction with measurable results.

opportunities.name: Resonance Center for Women
opportunities.description: Resonance is a dually accredited, gender specific, outpatient drug and alcohol treatment facility.

opportunities.name: Restore Hope Ministries
opportunities.description: The mission of Restore Hope Ministries is to restore families in financial crisis to economic and spiritual vitality.

opportunities.name: Revitalize T-Town
opportunities.description: Revitalize T-Town’s free home repair program offers repairs in three focus areas. All repairs focus on safety, security and weatherproofing

opportunities.name: River Parks Authority

opportunities.name: Rooms with a Heart Organization
opportunities.description: Rooms With A Heart, Inc. is a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization whose principal purpose is to develop and construct customized rooms for children with critical illnesses.

opportunities.name: RSVP of Tulsa
opportunities.description: RSVP enhances our communities by engaging volunteers, age 55 and over, matching their experiences, talents and interests to meaningful service.

opportunities.name: Saint Francis Health System
opportunities.description: Saint Francis Health System will be the leading integrated Catholic healthcare system providing high quality, comprehensive and innovative care across our regional continuum of services.

opportunities.name: James Inc
opportunities.description: The mission of JAMES INC is to provide an mentoring source for young teen parents to assist them in reaching educational aspirations while creating a comfortable supportive environment.

opportunities.name: South Tulsa Community House
opportunities.description: STCH seeks to provide leadership to Riverwood through its ability to enhance public awareness and improve quality of life by engaging the Tulsa community at large.

opportunities.name: Special Kids Care
opportunities.description: We support the right of every child and his or her family, regardless of ability, to participate as full members of families, communities, and society.

opportunities.name: St. John Auxiliary
opportunities.description: The St. John Auxiliary also continues our commitment to inspire our future health care leaders through our junior volunteer programs.

opportunities.name: Theatre Tulsa
opportunities.description: The mission of the Theatre Tulsa is to create quality theatrical experiences and promote the theatrical arts for the Tulsa community.

opportunities.name: The Center for Individuals with Physical Challenges
opportunities.description: "Providing opportunities for individuals with physical challenges to enhance the quality of their lives"

opportunities.name: The Lemon-Aid Project
opportunities.description: Lemon-Aid is raising money for those in need, raising awareness of amazing organization that serve our fellow Tulsans AND empower Tulsa youth with critical entrepreneurial and philanthropic skills.

opportunities.name: The Nature Conservancy of Oklahoma
opportunities.description: To conserve the lands and waters on which all life depends.

opportunities.name: The Salvation Army of Metro Tulsa
opportunities.description: Its mission is to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ and to meet human needs in His name without discrimination.
opportunities.work_type: Social Services, Humanitarian Aid, Spiritual Care

opportunities.name: The Tulsa Day Center for the Homeless
opportunities.description: The mission of the Tulsa Day Center for the Homeless is to provide a safe and healthy environment for people who are homeless and provide opportunities and encouragement for achieving self-sufficiency.

opportunities.name: True Blue Neighbors at the University of Tulsa
opportunities.description: Building a better community, a better citizen and a better university through service, advocacy, civic engagement, and informed policy.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Area United Way
opportunities.description: The Tulsa Area United Way unites people and resources to improve lives and build a stronger community.

opportunities.name: Tulsa City-County Library
opportunities.description: Tulsa City-County Library envisions a Tulsa County that works together, where all are knowledgeable and where everyone is reaching for his or her full potential.

opportunities.name: Tulsa County Social Services
opportunities.description: Tulsa County Social Services provides basic services such as food, clothing, shelter, health care and medication services.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Crime Stoppers/Crime Prevention Network
opportunities.description: Our mission is to provide valuable crime prevention education and safety awareness service to residents and public safety providers in the greater Tulsa area.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Debate League
opportunities.description: Debate prepares students to thrive in the 21st century. Debaters learn how to think critically - to unpack arguments, dissect research, and evaluate choices.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Dream Center
opportunities.description: Tulsa Dream Center exists to empower the community of North Tulsa to know God and to experience transformation.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Girls Art School Project, INC.
opportunities.description: Tulsa Girls Art School is an afterschool, social service program that uses art as a vehicle to reach our students. Our students learn entrepreneurialism, fiscal responsibility, art show curation, and public speaking skills during their time here

opportunities.name: Tulsa Glassblowing School
opportunities.description: variety of glass art disciplines via education, instruction, and promotion of hot glass art including opportunities to observe nationally renowned visiting glass artists.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Habitat for Humanity
opportunities.description: Seeking to put God’s love into action, Tulsa Habitat for Humanity brings people together to build homes, communities and hope. Our vision is to live in a world where everyone has a place to call home.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Honor Academy
opportunities.description: At Tulsa Honor Academy, our vision is to develop successful college graduates who will become well-rounded, engaged community members and who will transform their communities.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Regional STEM Alliance
opportunities.description: Increase awareness and access to STEM resources and activities through a centralized information sharing network to inform TRSA stakeholders and STEM advocates in the Tulsa region.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Route 66 Main Street
opportunities.description: Tulsa Route 66 Main Street community becomes an appreciated, historically unique destination.

opportunities.name: Tulsa SPCA
opportunities.description: Since 1913 we have been working with animal lovers in Tulsa and surrounding communities to improve the lives of dogs and cats and their human companions.

opportunities.name: Volunteers of America Oklahoma
opportunities.description: Volunteers of America Oklahoma's mission is to respond to Oklahomans in need and to create opportunities for people to experience the joy of serving others.

opportunities.name: Green Country Workforce Development
opportunities.description: Green Country Workforce Development fuels economic development by creating relationships that benefit employers and job seekers by placing talent today while preparing individuals for the jobs of tomorrow.

opportunities.name: Working in Neighborhoods
opportunities.description: Mission Statement: To promote community education, develop and sustain private-public partnerships that enhance public safety, neighborhood revitalization and the quality of life of all residents within our city.

opportunities.name: Young People of the Next Generation
opportunities.description: We want more of Oklahoma’s young people to become part of the workforce that benefits from changing technology and is not punished by it.

opportunities.name: Youth Services of Tulsa
opportunities.description: YST constantly adapts to stay on top of the ever-changing, increasingly complex needs of young people, ages 12 to 24. YST is the only Tulsa nonprofit organization focused solely on adolescents and transition-age youth.

opportunities.name: The Metropolitan Environmental Trust
opportunities.description: The M.e.t. partners with member communities to develop, deliver and support environmental programs and services, and to educate citizens on sound environmental practices.

opportunities.name: SCORE
opportunities.description: SCORE is a nationwide volunteer organization dedicated to helping individuals intending to start a small business and those already in business desiring advice.

opportunities.name: StreetsCats
opportunities.description: StreetCats, Inc is a non-profit organization, founded in 1997, whose purpose is to shelter cats that have been abandoned or lost and to find new homes for them.

opportunities.name: Elara Caring
opportunities.description: Elara Caring is to the be the one stop solution for patients, caregivers and healthcare providers, for health care resourcing, care setting transitions, patient empowerment, and so much more through the golden years of our community’s elderly demographic.

opportunities.name: Francesca's Music Box
opportunities.description: Our mission is to cure PTSD and trauma with music therapy. Accessible music lessons are a key to self esteem and a quality life.

opportunities.name: The Arc of Oklahoma
opportunities.description: The Arc of Oklahoma is committed to ensuring a high quality of life for individuals with developmental disabilities and their families.

opportunities.name: Rivercross Hospice
opportunities.description: Rivercross Hospice provides hospice services to terminally ill adults all throughout NE Oklahoma.

opportunities.name: USA BMX
opportunities.description: USA BMX is the official sanctioning body of BMX racing in the US and Canada.

opportunities.name: Grace Hospice
opportunities.description: As a Grace Hospice volunteer, you'll be an important member of the hospice care team, helping to serve a wide range of people with a variety of life-limiting illnesses in Tulsa and surrounding communities.

opportunities.name: Permanent Diaper Relief
opportunities.description: Permanent Diaper Relief provides diapers and resources through multiple programs focusing on empowerment and self-sufficiency through education and sustainable products.

opportunities.name: Mend Medical Services
opportunities.description: Mend Medical Services demonstrates the love of Christ by equipping and supporting women before, during, and after an unexpected pregnancy.

opportunities.name: Suncrest Hospice
opportunities.description: Our Mission is to provide the highest quality of care and customer service to our patients, their families, and our referring sources.

opportunities.name: ZERO Prostate Cancer
opportunities.description: Mission ZERO Prostate Cancer is the leading national nonprofit with the mission to end prostate cancer and help all who are impacted. ZERO advances research, provides support, and creates solutions to achieve health equity to meet the most critical needs of our community.

opportunities.name: Congregation Bnai Emunah
opportunities.description: We are an official Resettlement and Placement office servicing the needs of refugee arrivals during their first months in Tulsa.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Symphony Orchestra
opportunities.description: The Tulsa Symphony Orchestra is a vital community service organization that entertains, educates, heals, and inspires through musical excellence, innovation, and collaboration. Enriching lives everywhere through musical excellence

opportunities.name: Innovations Family Wellness Inc.
opportunities.description: Innovations Family Wellness (IFW) seeks to provide low-cost, high-quality, experienced, accessible perinatal care for families.

opportunities.name: Lala’s Gift
opportunities.description: Lala’s Gift is a non profit organization that supports and works with existing individuals and organizations to rescue, restore, and relieve children from human trafficking and natural disasters.

opportunities.name: One Hope Tulsa
opportunities.description: One Hope exists to create flourishing neighborhoods in Northeast Tulsa where relationships build resilience and hope changes outcomes.

opportunities.name: Tulsa Timebank
opportunities.description: Foster a vibrant and interconnected community by sharing our time with one another.
